questions.question: The 4% rule means you can withdraw:
questions.explanation: The 4% rule suggests withdrawing 4% of your portfolio value annually in retirement, adjusted for inflation.

questions.question: Employer matching is like getting:
questions.explanation: Employer matching provides an immediate 100% return on your contribution up to the match percentage.

questions.question: Compound interest works best:
questions.explanation: Compound interest's power increases exponentially with time, making long time periods most effective.

questions.question: A Roth IRA offers:
questions.explanation: Roth IRAs offer tax-free growth and tax-free withdrawals in retirement, with no required minimum distributions.

questions.question: The Rule of 72 helps calculate:
questions.explanation: The Rule of 72 estimates how long it takes to double your money: divide 72 by the interest rate.

questions.question: Why is starting retirement savings early so important?
questions.explanation: Starting early allows compound interest more time to work, meaning smaller contributions are needed to reach retirement goals.

questions.question: What percentage of pre-retirement income should you plan to replace?
questions.explanation: Most financial planners recommend replacing 70-80% of pre-retirement income to maintain your lifestyle.
